intro: Lychnis intermedia, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are often succulent and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually hairless. Its flowers are small, pink to red, and arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Lychnis intermedia thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as coastal dunes and rocky slopes.
